title: In A First, Victoria's Secret Welcomes Plus Sized Model, Ali Tate Cutler & She's Gorgeous!
text:
Victoria's Secret just embraced inclusivity in the best possible way. The leading lingerie brand recently welcomed its first plus sized model onboard. Celebrating body image, irrespective of size and shape, has become one of the most crucial topics of this decade.

People across the board have been slamming stereotyping and body-shaming when it comes to women of different sizes, and popular brands have taken notice and acted accordingly.

Women across the world now believe in embracing their body, with its own set of curves and flaws and celebrate who they are.

On October 4, the brand announced a partnership with U.K.-based lingerie brand Bluebella. It took a collaboration to get there, but for the first time in its history, Victoria's Secret will feature a plus-size model.

Victoria Secret has hired its first-ever plus-size model: Ali Tate Cutler. The brunette beauty stars in a campaign for the female-founded lingerie label Bluebella.

Ali Tate Cutler is the first US size 14 model to appear on Victoria's Secret.

"I'm pretty stoked to work with a brand I idolized when I was a teen. Great step in the right direction for bodies," she said.

In an interview with E! News Cutler said, "I never expected that I was going to see an image of myself on the wall next to these top super models that I have been looking up to since I was a little girl. The whole thing came about when I got cast to be in Bluebella in London through my agents at Milk."

"I think if they continue to head in that direction they will be on to a jackpot because that is reflective of what the average woman is in America," she added.

However, when it comes to celebrating plus size, Victoria's Secret is certainly very late in the game. Models like Ashley Graham, Tess Holiday and a hundred other Instagram influencers have a carved out a niche in the plus size world, setting an example for others to follow.
